x_8821_code_code_snippet.description: UI Scripts are tricky and are sometimes of great risk to even test from the ServiceNow environment. They have access to the platform's source code and document object (DOM) at runtime, so they must be carefully constructed. See the comments below illustrating a carefully constructed UI Script that changes the color of Context Menu Items. Repurpose all of this code except for the "var css" line when constructing most of your UI Scripts.
x_8821_code_code_snippet.name: How to Create a UI Script Safely When Performing DOM Manipulation

}</sample_input><sample_output_client/><sample_output_server/><server_script><![CDATA[// Wait until the page is loaded before applying the style sheet, to ensure it's not overwritten by other styles or runtime JavaScript
addLoadEvent(function() {  

try { // Necessary to prevent failure, which at its worst could prevent the environment from even being useable

    // Onhover with Element

    // Create and append a style sheet so it executes after ServiceNow's existing style sheets
    var style = document.createElement('style');  
    if (style.styleSheet) {  
        style.styleSheet.cssText = css;  
    } else {  
        style.appendChild(document.createTextNode(css));  
    }

}
